title: How to manually trigger click event in ReactJS?
body:
You could use the ref attribute to acquire a reference to the underlying HTMLInputElement object through the provided callback, store the reference as a class property, then use that reference to later trigger a click from your event handlers:

<input ref={input => this.inputElement = input} ... />

uploadLogoIcon(e) {
    this.inputElement.click();
}

Note the ES6 arrow function that provides the correct lexical scope for this in the callback.
